text.section: An individual application need not be required from a person covered under a blanket health policy or contract, nor shall it be necessary for the insurer to furnish each person a certificate, if such person does not pay all or part of the premium for such insurance.

A person covered under a blanket health insurance policy or contract who pays any part of the premium or is required to submit an application as to such insurance shall be furnished a certificate by the insurer reasonably setting forth a summary of such person's coverage and restrictions thereon.

law.history: Created 1970 Ky. Acts ch. 301, subtit. 18, sec. 8, June 18, 1970.
